message.content:
The proper running form is crucial to maximizing performance and minimizing the risk of injury when running. Here are some tips for maintaining good running posture:

1. Head: Keep your head up and look ahead, not down at your feet. Your head should be in line with the spine, creating a straight line from your ears to your shoulders.

2. Shoulders: Keep your shoulders relaxed and slightly back (not rounded or hunched). Avoid tensing or lifting them toward your ears while you run.

3. Arms: Bend your arms at a 90-degree angle at the elbow and pump them forward and backward in sync with the opposite leg stride rather than side-to-side across the body.

4.ddddddddChest: Lift chest, keeping it open and tall â€“ imagine being pulled upward by a string attached to an article itemizing key pointers!

5.ddddddHips: Position hips under the torso to maintain balance throughout each step without leaning too far forward or backward.
